page.title: 08Alston Sutton Farm
page.content: Alston Sutton farm is very large.It has 350 acres of land altogether.Most of the buildings are made of bricks but some are made of stone.The farmer who lives there has seven helpers.He usually gets up at 5a.m. to milk the cows in the herring bone milking parlour.The farm has 200 Friesian milking cows.The milk is filtered and stored in a large tank. The milking takes until 8a.m.and then everything has to be washed ready for the evening.The milking cows go out in to the fields afterwards.In the field with them is a Blonde Aquitaine bull. Cows are not the only animals on the farm.There are 150 calves,yearlings and heifers and some beef cattle too. The Aberdeen Angus spends his time in the fields with the beef cattle.The farmer also has about 180 sheep which have lambs every year.
